reviews.text: 'Hotel Theophano' makes for a nice stay in a central setting, right at Quedlinburg's main market square. The hotel itself is a beautifully renovated medieval building and its owners have managed to capture its historic flair in the tastefully decorated rooms. Our room had a four poster bed, TV, telephone and a modern bathroom. We paid Euro 120 for one night, which included a good breakfast. If you have trouble with stairs, this hotel might not be right for you. In order to retain its historic character, the hotel does not have an elevator.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel in City Center
That's "Romantik" for you
reviews.text: On our return trip to Norway (from France) we decided for at detour to the remote village of Quedlinburg in the old East Germany. Quedlingburg is a story of it's own being on the Unesco list. Theophano fits into this, old wooden hotel, excellent welcoming, friendly and helpful staff, lovely and "romantic" room with private balcony and a large bathroom. So quiet and peaceful. If you should be in the region, go for the Theophano!! Best value for money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try their restaurant as well. A gem.
reviews.title: Perfection.

reviews.text: This hotel is in a beautifully restored merchant's house in this lovely town. Our spotlessly clean room was spacious, furnished with exquisite taste, and had a lovely view of the market square ( which was quiet at night ). The buffet breakfast was superb, and dinner at the hotel's vaulted restaurant nearby was a most enjoyable experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed four nights at this historic burger house. Tasteful rooms all different in style and decor. I was fortunate enough to be given a room with stunning views of the Marktplatz.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in fairy tale town

reviews.text: Staff are very friendly and helpful.. nothing is too much trouble. I was given tips on events and went to a beautiful concert in a Middle age church.. just a few locals and the vicar. Very moving.
reviews.title: Little known gem
